revised_title: Theoretical Prediction of Physical Properties of Many-Electron Atoms and Ions
tldr: The author presents a method to theoretically predict the physical properties of many-electron atoms and ions, such as mole refraction, diamagnetic susceptibility, and extension in space. The method involves idealizing electron shells as uniform surface charges and using the wave mechanics of Schrödinger to derive theoretical values for screening constants. This approach allows for the calculation of various properties of atoms and monatomic ions.
